properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 2:27PM MST until February 4 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Goodland KS
properties.description:
...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW EXPECTED MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...

A strong upper-level trough moving over the Central High Plains
will provide broad support for snowfall tonight through Tuesday
across most of the forecast area. Snowfall amounts will range from
1 to 4 inches with higher amounts expected generally along and
north of Interstate 70. Wind gusts to 30 mph could also lead to
patchy blowing snow at times through Tuesday evening.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...In Kansas, Wallace, Logan and Gove Counties. In
Colorado, Cheyenne County County.

* WHEN...From 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Monday to 11 PM MST /midnight
CST/ Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind gusts to 30 mph could make blowing
snow a possibility Monday night through Tuesday evening. Travel
may be difficult at times in reduced visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ TUESDAY
